channel.title: How do i put in codes
channel.description:
can someone please help me enter in codes.
it would be greatly apreciated..
even admin or co-owner of my server, MeepedScape :P

item.title: How do i put in codes
item.dc:creator: @haruki haruki
item.description:
@haruki wrote:

first of all all of the if (npcs[i].npcType == 716) { if (misc.random2(50) == 1) { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "The dead has awaken!"; } }

that you should be seeing is the npc id and what its saying,the 716 after the two == is the id, the sentence inside the " things is what is will say,the (misc.random2(50) == 1) is basically the timer (how much it will say what it is told to say,for mine i usually replace the 50 with a 7 or 15,so that people dont usually miss the message

for yours i made a code that is easy,here is is(below)

if (npcs[i].npcType == 3431) { if (misc.random2(15) == 1) { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "MY GOD! I CAN FLY!"; } }

lol so just put this under moo,wich is rite here

npcs[i].textUpdate = "Moo";

after the little ; your push enter so you have some space,go to the line UNDER the moo statement and put in the code i made for you!

Read full topic
item.source: How do i put in codes

well if you open any of them to set it to notepad then we are good. Then the main file you will be using to code will be client.java. If you set any of the java’s to notepad ALL of them will auto-work with notepad

item.title: How do i put in codes
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

well if your talking in game then you use (::) [ = any command prgramed into your server]. If you are talking about actually adding in code to the server files (.java / .cfg / .txt / .DAT), then what you want to do is click on it and a menu should show up asking you what program you want to use to open it. Click “select a program from a list”. Then scroll down/up until you see notepad. Click notepad (ONLY ONCE) and then click the box at the bottom that says “Always use the selected program to run that kind of file” (make sure its checked, somtimes this is auto-matic for the list), then click “ok”. Do this exact thing for all of the file types I named above (of course you dont need it for the .txt). Now you should be able to double click on almost all the files and they will open to code (dont do the thing above to the .class. The class files are compiled java files). Now you can use tuts (tutorials) to edit your server, or you can figure everything out like I did. Enjoy this and I hope it helped a lot!

~Mod Taharok

[hidefromsilab]I eat rep++ for breakfast!!![/hidefromsilab]

Read full topic
